techmeme.title: Mike Novogratz's Galaxy says it has secured $1.4B in debt financing to expand its Helios data center in West Texas, aiming to boost AI and HPC capabilities (CoinDesk)
Opendoor CEO Carrie Wheeler steps down, with Shrisha Radhakrishna named president and interim CEO; OPEN jumps 8%+ (Norah Mulinda/Bloomberg)
Sam Altman says OpenAI "totally screwed up some things" on the GPT-5 rollout and confirms plans to fund a brain-computer interface startup to rival Neuralink (Alex Heath/The Verge)
CoreWeave's IPO lockup expires, letting holders of 80%+ of its Class A shares sell; its stock fell 33% in the two days after its Q2 earnings amid selloff fears (Carmen Reinicke/Bloomberg)
Klarna reports Q2 revenue up 25% YoY to $823M and net loss up 194% YoY to $53M, as it prepares for a second attempt at a US IPO, after pausing plans in April (Akila Quinio/Financial Times)
